div.p: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts defined as part of this implementation guide.
General constraints on FHIR resources to be adhered to as part of the CG implementation guide that apply regardless of what area(s) of genomics are of interest

tr.td: Base profile that defines characteristics shared by all genetic observations
Defines the overall genetic report
Constraints on Specimen for use with clinical genomics reporting
Task describing the followup that is recommended
The lab order or request that triggered the execution of the genetics test
Organizes information within a genetic report
Provides a coarse overall interpretation of the genetic results reported.
Provides an overall interpretation of whether any deletions or duplications were found as part of the genetic analysis
Provides a coarse overall interpretation of the chromosomal analysis results reported.
Properties common to genetic findings whose results are expressed as narrative
Properties common to genetic findings whose results are expressed as computable discrete elements (e.g. genotypes, haplotypes, variants, etc.)
Assertion of a particular haplotype on the basis of one or more variants
Assertion of a particular genotype on the basis of one or more variants or haplotypes
Fully describes a variant with a single code. Typically a large variant such as a mosaic, abnormal chromosome numbers, etc.
A variant consisting of multiple independent consecutive variations
Details about a set of changes in the tested sample compared to a reference sequence.
A profile on sequence that limits it to definitional elements, excluding patient-specific measurement information
Indicates whether two sequences are in Cis (same strand) or Trans (opposite strand) relationship to each other
Abstract profile for observations describing the impact of one or more genetic observations.
Provides an indication of whether there's a pathologic risk associated with a particular genotype, haplotype, variant or combination there-of, and if so, what the associated pathology is.

div.p: Profiles related to the reporting of somatic genetic issues

tr.td: Finding of whether a particular somatic genotype/haplotype/variation or combination-thereof provides evidence for or against a particular type of cancer or the effectiveness of different interventions
Finding of whether a particular somatic genotype/haplotype/variation or combination-thereof supports or opposes the diagnosis of a particular cancer

Finding of whether a particular somatic genotype/haplotype/variation or combination-thereof predicts a particular outcome for the specified cancer - either on its own or in conjunction with one or more interventions
Finding of whether a particular somatic genotype/haplotype/variation or combination-thereof predicts the impact of a specified medication or combination of medications

div.p: Profiles for reports relating to genetic impact on medication use and effectiveness

tr.td: Abstract profile with common properties for observations that convey the potential impact of a genetic characteristics on a medication
Assertion of the expected impact of a particular genotype on the ability of the subject to metabolize medications
Assertion of the expected impact of a particular genotype on the efficacy of medications for the subject
Assertion of whether the patient has a high-risk allele
Task describing what sort of change (if any) should be made in a patient's medication based on an identified genotype
MedicationStatement describing a med potentially being taken by the patient that may require adjustment
Chromosome analysis that uses traditional banding technique.
Fluorescence in situ hybridization test results
Details about the copy number pair, such as the base pair start and end coordinates of where the change occurred.
Information about a micro-array platform used as part of copy number change testing
Information about the probe used in a FISH test

div.p: Extensions defined as part of the CG implementation guide

tr.td: Captures citations, evidence and other supporting documentation for the observation or report
References a proposed action that is recommended based on the results of the diagnostic report
Additional information relevant to interpreting/understanding the report
Allows an observation to be made about multiple things.
References a proposed action that is recommended based on the results of the observation.
If true, indicates that the observation was not asked for as part of the report but was provided as additional useful information by the reporting lab or other service provider.
Indicates the manufacturer for a particular component

div.p: Example(s) showing the use of the CG profiles

tr.td: Test instance showing data from the CG v2 spec
Pharmacogenomic Report Example instances
HLA Typing Example
